title: Slope of a Line
text: The slope of a line can be determined using two points $$(x_1,y_1)$$, $$(x_2,y_2)$$ by subtracting the y-values over the x-values: $$\frac{y_2-y_1}{x_2-x_1}$$.

title: Slope of a Line

title: Point-Slope Form
text: The point slope formula can be used to get the function of a line through the given point: $$y-y_1=m \left(x-x_1\right)$$ where $$m$$ is the slope and $$(x_1,y_1)$$ is the point.

title: Point-Slope Form
text: Substituing $$m=\frac{-1}{2}$$ and $$(-3,2)$$ for the point, the formula is equal to $$y-2=-\left(\frac{1}{2}\right) \left(x+3\right)$$.
